item.title: Polyglot Programming dan GraalVM
item.description: Pernahkah mendengar istilah polyglot programming? Istilah ini sudah menjadi istilah yang umum dan barangkali banyak didengar oleh para developer yang sehari-hari memang berkutat dengan bahasa pemrograman dan peranti pengembangan. Polyglot programming merupakan penggunaan lebih dari satu bahasa pemrograman untuk menyelesaikan suatu masalah pemrograman. Kategori polyglot programming antara lain adalah: Penggunaan binding yang dibuat menggunakan suatu bahasa pemrograman tertentu (biasanya bahasa pemrograman aras sistem — atau aras rendah seperti C/C++, Assembly, Rust) ke suatu bahasa yang berada pada aras tinggi seperti Ruby, Python, dan lain-lain.

item.title: Using YugabyteDB in Python App Development
item.description: As a long time PostgreSQL user, it’s normal that YugabyteDB got my attention. It’s a distributed SQL database which features-compatible with PostgreSQL so that I don’t need to lose my investation. YugabyteDB reuses PostgreSQL’s query layer, so I can use my development tools as usual. It gives me more since there is also Cassandra query layer. Using YugabyteDB I can reuse my SQL skill and development tools, enhanced with NOSQL data model (especially wide-column store), while I have NewSQL’s resiliency, scalability, and high performance.

item.title: Idiomatic Programming
item.description: Salah satu hal yang menghambat orang untuk belajar adalah banyaknya istilah-istilah yang membingungkan. Semua domain pengetahuan biasanya memang mempunyai istilah-istilah sendiri dan meskipun ada satu istilah yang muncul di lebih dari satu domain pengetahuan, pengertiannya seringkali tidak sama sehingga pemahaman tentang istilah bersifat context-dependent (harus dilihat konteksnya). Mempelajari pemrograman juga kurang lebih harus memahami berbagai macam istilah yang muncul. Kali ini saya akan menjelaskan sedikit tentang istilah idiomatic programming. item.title: Managing a Software Development Team: Some Experiences
item.description: Managing a software development team is never an easy task. It consists of 2 sides: technical things non-technical things. This task is often assigned to the project manager, VP Engineering, Software Development Manager, etc. To be succeed, one has to consider those 2 sides. In this article, I will ouline some of my experiences in managing a software development team. This list is not meant to be complete nor perfect. You may need more but at least you will be in the safety line level one if you do care with these issues.

item.title: Agile Development: Welcome Changing Requirements?
item.description: If you ever being in a team which practices agile software development, you might already heard about how a software development team “welcome chnging requirements”. While it sounds great, I personally think, if this statement is not properly explained, the impact will be negative on the development team side. Now, let’s see the complete statement: Welcome changing requirements, even late in development. Agile processes harness change for the customer’s competitive advantage.

item.title: Core Values for Software Developer
item.description: So you are interested in software development and want to become one who do that job. Initially you think that it’s only a matter of coding. creating source code, have them compiled, and then deploy the software for the customer/client. Later on, you realize that developing software is hard. Even harder since so many things beyond technical issues are also involved. Suddenly you realize that what you have learned in school is not enough.

item.title: About
item.description: Zimera Corporation was founded on February 14th, 2022 under the name of PT Zenit Merdeka Raya. The name Zimera has a simple meaning, taking from African language: one that creates. This name becomes the underlying philosophy of Zimera Operation: to create. In a broader sense, we do really appreciate anybody who creates something. It is not limited to just create a software per se, but also other things: create a better SOP (Standard Operating Procedure), create a solution to a problem not related with software creation, etc.
